skill.name: Plugin Structure
skill.description: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a plugin", "scaffold a plugin", "understand plugin structure", "organize plugin components", "set up plugin.json", "use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}", "add commands/agents/skills/hooks", "configure auto-discovery", or needs guidance on plugin directory layout, manifest configuration, component organization, file naming conventions, or Claude Code plugin architecture best practices.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when the user asks to "create a plugin", "scaffold a plugin", "understand ...
skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing markdown files with code examples for plugin development. All 559 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - the analyzer incorrectly flags markdown code fences and YAML frontmatter as executable code. This skill has no executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. All content is static documentation from Anthropic's official plugins repository.

content.value_statement: Claude Code plugins require specific directory layouts and manifest configurations. This skill provides comprehensive documentation on plugin architecture, component organization, and best practices for building maintainable plugins that integrate seamlessly.
actual_capabilities: Explains required plugin directory structure and conventions
Documents plugin.json manifest fields and configuration
Describes component types (commands, agents, skills, hooks)
Offers best practices for plugin organization and naming
limitations: This is documentation-only - it does not create files or execute code
Does not validate existing plugin structures
Does not generate plugin boilerplate code
Does not install or configure MCP servers

use_cases.title: Set up new plugin
use_cases.description: Learn the required directory structure, manifest configuration, and naming conventions for Claude Code plugins.

use_cases.title: Enforce standards
use_cases.description: Understand component organization patterns to establish consistent plugin architecture across your team.

use_cases.title: Reference patterns
use_cases.description: Access complete examples and references for documenting plugin components and configuration options.

prompt_templates.title: Create a plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a new Claude Code plugin with the correct directory structure and plugin.json manifest.

prompt_templates.title: Organize components
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the differences between commands, agents, skills, and hooks. When should I use each type?

prompt_templates.title: Manifest reference
prompt_templates.prompt: What are all the available fields in plugin.json? Show me examples for each field type.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me an advanced plugin example with MCP servers, hooks, and shared libraries. How should I organize a large plugin?

output_examples.input: How do I set up a new plugin?
output: Required structure: plugin-name/.claude-plugin/plugin.json and component directories
Minimal plugin needs only name field in manifest
Commands go in commands/ directory as .md files
Agents go in agents/ directory as .md files
Skills go in skills/skill-name/ with SKILL.md file

best_practices: Use kebab-case for all directory and file names to ensure cross-platform compatibility
Keep plugin.json lean - rely on auto-discovery for standard component directories
Always use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} instead of hardcoded absolute paths
Group related components logically and document the plugin purpose in a README
anti_patterns: Nesting component directories inside .claude-plugin/ - they must be at plugin root level
Using hardcoded paths like /Users/name/plugins/ instead of ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}
Skipping the SKILL.md file in skill directories - it is required for discovery
Using spaces or special characters in plugin names - use kebab-case only

faq.question: What is the minimum required for a Claude Code plugin?
faq.answer: A plugin needs a .claude-plugin/plugin.json with at least a name field, plus at least one component directory like commands/.

faq.question: Where should I put my plugin components?
faq.answer: Commands, agents, skills, and hooks directories must be at the plugin root level, not inside .claude-plugin/.

faq.question: How does auto-discovery work?
faq.answer: Claude Code automatically finds all .md files in commands/ and agents/, and SKILL.md files in skills/ subdirectories.

faq.question: What is ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}?
faq.answer: An environment variable pointing to the plugin installation directory. Use it for all path references to make plugins portable.

faq.question: Can I use custom paths for components?
faq.answer: Yes, specify custom paths in plugin.json. They supplement default directories but do not replace them.

faq.question: What file naming conventions should I follow?
faq.answer: Use kebab-case for all names. Commands and agents are .md files, skills are directories with SKILL.md inside.
